bug.description: Hi, Thanks for the great library! I've been trying to use the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kornia/kornia/blob/cdd8f01f5ff6e1c7ac68b47137f0f77bd671ba4d/kornia/geometry/transform/imgwarp.py#L111>warp_affine</denchmark-link> function using the interpolation (as opposed to the default interpolation). However, in the function definition it looks like the parameter is not used. depends on <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kornia/kornia/blob/cdd8f01f5ff6e1c7ac68b47137f0f77bd671ba4d/kornia/geometry/transform/imgwarp.py#L57>transform_warp_impl</denchmark-link> which doesn't have the or keyword for interpolation. in turn depends on which does have the keyword for interpolation. Finally, it seems like, the keyword is passed to and this is where the interpolation actually happens. But it seems like the interpolation mode is "lost" when going from to the eventual . Is there any plan to fix this? It can be quite confusing when reading the docs, since warp_affine's behaviour does not change when changing the interpolation mode. Thank you!
